result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James E. Klotz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerked by AP. 
Defendant James E. Klotz in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COURT RECORD COVERS CASES 15CM151, 15CF466,15CF462 AND 15CF188

15CM151
Count #3:  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Count #4:  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.
IMPOSED & STAYED 
Count #390 days jail  (with huber and good time and 9 days credit)
Count #4 - 30 days jail   (with huber and good time) to run consecutive with count #3.
2 years probation (probation is concurrent)
AODA
Any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by PO
Pay court costs to include DNA surcharge, but no sample.

15CF466
Count #1:  State moves to dismiss and read-in.  Court grants motion.
Count #2:  State moves to dismiss and read-in.  Court grants motion.
(State moves to dismiss and read-in uncharged misdemeanor bail jumping, and possession of drug paraphernalia)

15CF462
Count #1:  State moves to amend to misdemeanor bail jumping 946.49(1)(a) a Class A Misdemeanor.  Court grants motion.  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.
(State moves to dismiss and read-in uncharged retail theft - court grants)
Imposed and stayed:  60 days jail consecutive to 15CM151 with huber and good time).
2 years probation to run concurrent with other probationary periods.
AODA
47 hours Community Service
Any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by PO.
Pay court costs to include DNA surcharge.  Any cash posted to apply to costs.
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court.

15CF188
Count #1:  State moves to dismiss and read-in.  Court grants motion.
(State moves to dismiss and read-in uncharged possession of drug paraphernalia - court grants)  

Court finds it would not be adverse to public interest to grant expunction if defendant is eligible.
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court

ADDRESS INFO for James E. Klotz
Current: 916 Craite Avenue, Rice Lake, WI 54868 United States  (Effective: 03-21-2016)
Prior: 312 North Third St, Barron, WI 54812

Clerked by WH. 
Defendant James E. Klotz in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Covers 15CF188, 15CF462, 15CM151, 15CF466.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant James E. Klotz in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF462, 15CF466, 15CF188 and 15CM151 called.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant James E. Klotz in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF188, 15CF462, 15CF466, 15CM151.
15CF462: Waive of reading of Information.  Not guilty plea entered.
15CF466: Waive reading of Information.  Not guilty pleas entered on both counts.
15CF188: Reset.
15CF151: Reset.
All cases reset to 01-04-2016 @ 2:00 p.m.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.
Not possess or consume THC or marijuana.  Not possess any drug paraphernalia.

10/16/2015:  BOND AMENDED FROM $500.00 BOND TO $100.00 BOND.  COVERS BOTH 15CF462 & 15CF466.  ADDED CONDITION:  MUST NOT POSSESS OR CONSUME ANY CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES OR DRUG PARAPHERNALIA.  ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

Defendant James E. Klotz in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant James E. Klotz in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:22 Officer Weigand with the City of Barron PD called, sworn and direct by state.
Judicial notice taken in 15CF462, 15CF188 and 15CM151.
Witness identified the defendant
2:00 cross by Attorney Raymond
Argument by State
Argument by Defense
State gives more argument
Probable Cause Found and Bound Over

Defense's request for a bond modification. State objects.
Court amends the bond to a $100 cash bond that covers 15CF462 & 15CF466 with same conditions. Plus must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

  Arraignment scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.
Not possess or consume THC or marijuana.  Not possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant James E. Klotz in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant James E. Klotz in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15CF466, 15CM151 & 15CF188

Qualifies for public defender and Ryan Raymond will represent.

Complaint reading waived in 15CF466.

State requests Diversion Court DPA be revoked on 15CM151 and 15CF188.  Court grants.  Files track.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
